name: Antonio MalvaGomes
title: Partner/Rails Engineer
description: I am a current student at Clemson University set to graduate in May of 2013 with a B.S. Computer Science degree.  I have several years of experience in computer science with an emphasis in web development using Ruby on Rails.  I am currently involved in a start-up technology research firm as an equity partner.  My languages of preference include but are not limited to C, C++, Ruby, PHP, Java, and a tiny bit of Python.  In my spare time, I enjoy camping, making music, and the beautiful outdoors.

name: David May
title: Director of Creative Services
description: Grew up in Berlin, Germany where I had an early interest in ASCII/ANSI art. First pixel based editor was Deluxe Paint. Enjoyed the peak of BBSing and the demoscene where I gained interest in music and programming. Working in the design field, professionally, for 10+ years. Currently as a Director of Creative Services in the U.S.. Interested in the convergence of art & technology, data vis, info design, typography, design thinking, UX, and much more.

name: Francisco Zarate
title: Regional IT Manager
description: I've been a linux user since 1995 and doing desktop apps since 2001 that year i started a software company to provide solutions to companies. Currently i'm working on Flex and .net making web applications. For the past 12+ years, I've worked professionally with: Adobe Flex, .Net, C#, Groovy, Delphi, Oracle, Weblogic, Tomcat, RedHat RHEL 5 and 6.

name: Yulian Kuncheff
title: Software Engineer
description: I started out programming when I was 14, and have been teaching myself everything I can since then. I currently am focused on Node.js, Dart, and Python as my languages of choice with a lot of Java for work. C# is my preferred Java equivalent, and use it when I can. Other than that I am a gamer and work for the biggest gaming company in the world. I also prefer to stick to latest technologies and let old technologies die. I dont use MySQL, PHP, or anything like that anymore. I keep current, and allow myself to move on and become a more versatile and better programmer.

name: Steve Verbeek
title: Web/Mobile Programmer
description: A 100% self taught web and mobile developer who dabbles in more traditional languages such as C in my spare time. An active open source contributor to many projects and a CTO of a local start up. You'll normally see me doing Mac related development, however I do spend some time with Windows!

name: David Pratt
title: President
description: Former chemist, an employee founder of UNBC, programmer and entrepreneur. Project lead for TideSDK, team member of refuge.io project and contributor to a variety of open projects in Python, Erlang and JavaScript. David loves programming scalable architecture, real time apps, node.js and the ocean (where he lives has higest Tide in the world - must have been destiny)

name: Shebin Rawther
title: Lead Developer and Graphic Designer
description: Mobile application developer and designer specialising in cross-platform development using Appcelerator Titanium framework. Experienced with a variety of languages and frameworks including, but not limited to php, Javascript, RoR, Node.js etc. Originally from Kerala in India, but currently working in the UK. Interested in learning languages, photography, playing the guitar and reading.

name: Marshall Culpepper
title: Hacker Extraordinaire
description: A versatile hacker and entrepreneur with a long history of open source contributions and leadership. Some of the projects I've worked on include Titanium Mobile and Desktop, WebKit, node.js, JBossIDE, JBossAOP, and Eclipse Webtools. I'm currently working on the FirefoxOS at Mozilla. When I'm not hacking, I'm usually spending time with my wife and kids near Denton, TX, or doing some long-distance road cycling.

name: Matthew Hershberger
description: Matthew is a project manager and Python/Javascript programmer for a cyber security firm. When he isn't programming he's out in the garage disassembling antique trucks and rebuilding them with electric engines and modern amenities.

name: Mitchell Amihod
title: Digital Shortstop
description: A web & mobile developer out in Montreal. I like building tools for others to work with, and enjoy prototyping. You can learn more at http://mitchell.amihod.com

name: Mital Vora
description: An expert in large scale projects design and implementation (mainly worked on backend / low-level). Works on variety of languages including C, C++, python, perl, ruby. Also an open-source enthusiast. Have worked on few open-source projects including Titanium (now TideSDK), http://code.mcrux.com/ fluidium, and others. Also an agile fan and love Test Driven Development.

name: Sharry Stowell
title: Senior Web Developer
description: Started in web development back in 2001 on the Isle of Man.  Experience with both front & backend web technologies, involved with several community projects.  Titanium community leader, creator of LearningTitanium & BuiltWithTitanium sites.  Love reading, learning all things new, keeping fit, mixed martial arts & spending time with my beautiful mrs & little genius son :)

name: Martin Robinson
title: Software Developer
description: I've been hooked on open source software for over a decade and love collaborating with healthy, productive communities to create software that makes people happier. Currently I spend my time hacking on WebKit, GNOME, and Cairo, making sure all the little pixels catch the bus on time.

name: Christian Engel
title: CTO
description: Chris is a computerfreak, who's interested in everything digital. During the last few years he has been highly active in the web-scene, because he's fascinated about the symbiosis of services and data there. He's currently working for a web design company in Frankfurt, Germany together with Christian Becker.

name: Kyle Welsby
title: Software Developer
description: I am a software application developer contributing my expertise via the world wide web over the past 12 years. I take huge enjoyment resolving sophisticated problems using an array of different coding languages, which include mainly include Ruby and JavaScript. Actively immerse myself into diverse communities and unique projects - learning, gaining and sharing knowledge with fellow thinkers and opportunists.

name: Mike Casto
title: Senior PHP Developer
description: I've been doing web page and application development since 1996 and it's how I make most of my income but my primary passion is teaching martial arts - specifically Filipino & Indonesian martial arts. I also edit videos and write - mostly martial arts related. For the past 15+ years, I've worked professionally with: Visual Basic, PHP, HTML/CSS, JavaScript, Titanium (mobile & desktop)

name: Peter Monte
title: Owner, CTO
description: GUI expert with background in communication design (online/offline) and over 13 years experience designing and implementing in multiple programming language for mobile, online and offline applications. Coding language are XML, XHTML, HTML 5, CSS 2, CSS 3, AS1, AS2, AS3, JavaScript, PHP, VBScript among others. An open source enthusiast seeking the best in creativity and effective programming.

name: Fredrik Wollsén
title: Freelance IT Entrepreneur
description:
During the last ten years, I have co-founded four start-ups, traveled the world and studied engineering while delivering solutions to Neam AB's clients.
Technically, I am fluent in cutting edge web technology and methods, with a major interest in data visualization and personal data mining.
Personally, I believe in open mindedness, rationality and honesty, and fill my free time with travel, social events and music of all sorts.
